main event: A sighting of a brilliant red and orange glowing object similar in shape to a T-33 occurred in Girly, Pennsylvania and Jackson, Michigan on 29 January 1960.
interesting points: The object was observed moving at high speed for about 1-3 seconds., A thorough investigation suggested the object might have been a meteor of the fireball type., The sighting was reported through a Project Blue Book record card., The observer detailed that the front of the object was brilliant red and emitted an orange glow from the rear., There were multiple assessments, including potential identification as a balloon or insufficient data.
sighted object: one glowing object resembling a T-33
witness description: Not provided but referred to in the report.
